website_summaries.verdict: This premium platform truck boasts a load capacity of 350 pounds.
pros: Versatile platform truck can be transformed into eight different configurations
Comes with deluxe tires that provide outstanding traction
Powder-coated steel frame ensures it will continue to perform both now and in the future
Compact size guarantees it won't take up a lot of space, regardless of where you store it
cons: Much smaller and less sturdy than many comparable platform trucks

customer_reviews.title: love it
customer_reviews.text: This cart is wonderful. I need something better than just a hand truck to haul all my items into a craft show. I am attaching photos but when I actually took it to craft fair I managed to put more on & only made one trip. folded it up to smallest & rolled right under one of my tables. Had a lot of attention from other vendors. My husband could not get over the quality for the price.
customer_reviews.author: sherry zimmerman

customer_reviews.title: Disappointing
customer_reviews.text: This cart is smaller and more difficult to use than I anticipated. The handles fold by way of a cable that you step on. It's a challenging and iffy process getting the pins to retract via the cable. I was afraid the handles wouldn't go down to get the thing in my vehicle...it was frustrating. I haven't yet figured out the other ways to configure the set up, am hoping to find something easier.
customer_reviews.author: EyeSusan

customer_reviews.title: Huh, not quite what I was expecting for 90 bucks
customer_reviews.text: Huh, not quite what I was expecting for 90 bucks. Its smaller than I thought even though I reviewed the dimensions so that's my bad. For some reason I had difficulty putting it together. To get the handles to bed you step on a cord and I manage to get my foot trapped everytime and squished. The tallest handle is not tall enough. It doesnt seem terribly sturdy. Things slide right off it. I guess I was expecting more of a industrial one. It does fold down to a nice small size. I could see this being a good item for moving items in an office setting, items to a trade show, etc.. I will probably end up returning it.
customer_reviews.author: Meda

customer_reviews.title: Cheap Construction | Defective
customer_reviews.text: (1) construction is cheap. The nail mechanism to secure the wheels only works if you mange to bend it at the right place. Any mistake would be hard to undo causing a lose connection. (2) poor documentation of steps. (3) simply doesnt work. The stupid mechanism of having to press down over the chain link to flatten or fix the handles upright is both backward and a hassle and unreliable.
customer_reviews.author: Shervin

customer_reviews.title: Great cart!!
customer_reviews.text: This is awesome and worth the money. Everything it says in the discription, the only thing that’s a small negative is it’s a little hard to fold but maybe because it’s new and just needs to be used! But I love it I’m a Ny city musician and it’s so easy to get around and it’s one trip for me. If you want an easy way to get your gear around with out busting your chops get one of these. You will need to spec out what size, I got smaller because I’m hauling around a Fender Deluxe and a prs 20 watt amp.
customer_reviews.author: solarwind

customer_reviews.title: Rust on frame when unpacking
customer_reviews.text: The product is lightweight and at a fair price for what you get. I like how super-compact it is. Mine had rust on the frame when I unpacked it from the box. I emailed AceProducts, the company who makes Rock N Roller. Five days later, I still have not received a response from them as others have pointed out in their Amazon reviews of this product.
customer_reviews.author: J

customer_reviews.title: Good, sturdy, convenient
customer_reviews.text: I keep this in my trunk. It's come in handy on several occasions (in my work on computers, servers, etc). Once I figured out how to work it, I can open it quickly, load it up and I don't look like a complete nerd doing it. It's sturdy, and has good wheels for holding a couple hundred pounds. Rolls well on hard surfaces. Not much on grass.
customer_reviews.author: R. Avery

customer_reviews.title: Excellent purchase
customer_reviews.text: I love that this is portable like small hand carts, but is about 1000% better. The hand cart I had was upright and had a small foot, so I'd need a bungee cord or else any box I put on it would fall right off when I tipped it back to roll the cart. This one holds probably 3x what the little hand cart held, but it's as portable and easy to unfold. The Rock-N-Roller is also much sturdier and easy to maneuver. I probably put 100-200 pounds of boxes / plastic tubs on it at a time and it has no trouble with them. Very happy with this purchase!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Handle too short for ease of pulling/pushing
customer_reviews.text: It needs a taller upright. Inconvenient to push or pull. Not sure it will survive many lifts over small changes in floor height. If one end had a tall handle I would give all 5 stars. I am sure I'll make some changes to it for more ease of pulling. The best change would be both uprights same tall height with a clothes hanger bar between them.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Works great for loading and unloading at Farmer's Markets and other events.
customer_reviews.text: I participate in a lot of events outside and in various venues like high schools. There is often a significant distance to haul your gear into a venue, especially if you have to make one trip per bin or box. This small footprint cart will hold and move just about anything I put on it although bungee cords are recommended for odd shaped items. It easily folds down for storage under a table in inside the vehicle. The cart itself is lightweight but holds tables, tent and supply bins with ease. It moves and steers well. Very happy, wouldn't change anything. Certainly a time and back saver.
customer_reviews.author: Tricia

customer_reviews.title: Not a fan of the....
customer_reviews.text: As a photographer who transports lights and gear, this fits it all, however not a fan of the taller handle and wish it was about 12 inches longer to push easier, it's kind of low. If you're a short guy or gal it's probably perfect, however I'm 6'3 and have to bend over to push the thing a little too much. Probably an attachment you can get, if so do it.
customer_reviews.author: M. Janes

customer_reviews.title: Great Cart for Craft Shows
customer_reviews.text: I do an awful lot of craft shows and absolutely hate setting up and tearing down because I'm old, have a bad back, and just plain grumpy. This cart has made a huge difference. I don't have to make so many back and forth trips to the car because it holds a lot of stuff. It also folds down into a very nice compact size so it doesn't take up a lot of space. It is versatile in the many different configurations and very, very easy to use. I mean super easy to set up and roll around. I'm pretty darn happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: LGKatz

customer_reviews.title: moves easier with wider wheels
customer_reviews.text: This is my third cart. First one lasted about 5 years with me and I gave it to one on my band members, he's still using it. Second one was a larger one that I've been using for the last 3 years, it,s getting a little heavy for me. Third one has larger lockable wheels and easier to maneuver on grass and much lighter to handle. I like this one and I am waiting till they make an all aluminium one.
customer_reviews.author: Houdini

customer_reviews.title: DO NOT UPGRADE!!!
customer_reviews.text: DO NOT UPGRADE!!! Upgraded cart just comes with bigger wheels that are improperly assembled from the factory. The first car had no grease fittings in the casters and they directional pattern was backwards. The second cart had grease fittings that wouldn’t accept grease... to find the wheels were assembled in the wrong direction again. My plan with the directional wheels is to go with inertia , not against it....
customer_reviews.author: Tyler Erik

customer_reviews.title: It broke the 2nd time I used it!
customer_reviews.text: The cable that raises and lowers the back arm broke the second time I used the cart. I pulled on it cable and it broke. I am a 60 year old woman. I am not that strong.
customer_reviews.author: cookiewookie

customer_reviews.title: I don't know how I ever used to manage without this little beast!
customer_reviews.text: Incredibly handy. I bring this cart with me to every gig now. It fits easily in the foot space between my front and back seats, folds out to accommodate and entire production worth of gear including 3 cameras, an audio kit, lighting kit, battery crate, and heavy light stands and c-stands. Paired with some ratchet straps, this thing is unstoppable. Definitely worth its cost, and recommended to anyone who moves equipment on a daily basis. It's been an invaluable resource on TV news shoots, where mobility is key.
customer_reviews.author: Stefan Fulton

customer_reviews.title: Definitely light duty ony
customer_reviews.text: It is always a little difficult to determine from a picture if the what you are looking at is what you want. I thought this was a bit more heavy duty than it actually was. It is a nice versatile cart for light items and it is well built. I am not a fan of the tension release cables that allow you change the configuration. Not what I thought I was ordering, but versatile enough for me to make use of in my shop.
customer_reviews.author: TRex

customer_reviews.title: Must be strong to open & close
customer_reviews.text: To open and close the cart a person needs to pull up on a cable which is awkward and difficult to do especially if you aren't that strong or agile. I was able to create a metal hook with handle so that I could pull the cable up to release the sides and open the cart. The cart is very durable and does hold a good deal of bins to transport. The wheels took bumps and a concrete curb ok.
customer_reviews.author: Creative Shopper

customer_reviews.title: Be careful raising the bars
customer_reviews.text: I was really hoping this would be as good as my GruvGear Solo Lite cart. My GruvGear was made like a tank and it's really simple to fold in the bars for traveling to and from gigs. With this monstrosity, I have to use brute strength to re-position the bars every time. It's a great way for an older person to hurt their back unless you're performing the task with the cart elevated up high enough that you don't have to bend over before exerting such force. I'd rather do my workouts at the gym, thank you.
customer_reviews.author: GuitarRebel

customer_reviews.title: Glad I got it...
customer_reviews.text: As a gigging drummer with a smaller kit (I play mainly jazz), this is a great way to get my stuff from car to venue, and back. I can get my kit, rug, stands all kinda piled on there, and roll it where it needs to go. It was actually surprisingly stable, and didn't rock/sway too much. If you pack/stack smart, you can get a good amount of stuff on there which makes the load-in/out that much easier and quicker. Also, folds down neatly for a small footprint.
customer_reviews.author: SEA2012

customer_reviews.title: Made moving in much easier
customer_reviews.text: Made moving into my new home much easier. The only problem I encountered was the cord you have to depress to make the thing collapse back to storage size. Eventually I got the hang of it but that feature could use some improving.
customer_reviews.author: A W

customer_reviews.title: Light weight but strong!
customer_reviews.text: Finally I have my own Rock N Roller! I have used one before that belong to a friend. They are so strong you can pile a lot on them. I also like that you can change the length if you need to. It is light weight and it folds for easy storage. It comes assembled you just have to put the wheels on. It was pretty easy. Great purchase. It’s almost time to load it up with Christmas tubs and start decorating.
customer_reviews.author: MoonShadow

customer_reviews.title: Nice cart, but typical Malaysian made quality.
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little cart and the 4th Rocknroller cart I've owned. Would have givin it 5 stars but the quality control is steadily going downhill on the Malaysian made carts. Axle was welded on wrong( fixed with 5/8 washers) fit and finish of other parts not that great but I'm a metalworker so I fixed rather then go though the hassle of an exchange
customer_reviews.author: Big Rand

customer_reviews.title: Rock Solid
customer_reviews.text: My first shipment came incomplete, but Amazon resolved the issue in two days! This R2RT cart is smaller in width than expected (11") not clearly stated IMO, but over all it is built very well. The front casters and wheels are good quality. Easy assembly. No regrets really.
customer_reviews.author: Marlyn

customer_reviews.title: Great cart for musicians
customer_reviews.text: This cart is very flexible - it can be used in multiple configurations and it easily adjusts to your desired length. Te price is the same as other carts that don't configure or adjust. It is as rugged as it needs to be - maybe not enough for heavy warehouse work or touring sound systems, but great for casual band work.
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Smerk

customer_reviews.title: Excellent compact cart
customer_reviews.text: This cart is amazing for its size. Nothing cheap about it. Assembles in minutes. Knobs and locking buttons work perfect. Folds up to super compact size. I use it to haul a trade show display. Fully extended it does not flinch at all when loaded up. Bars are somewhat narrow but made of thick steel. I would like to see a wider wheel base but I am sure the other models offer that. If you are stacking 100lb items I would probably get the larger size but the compactness of this model and the ease of folding it down are what make it perfect for average use. Folds down to where you could put it behind you car seat.
customer_reviews.author: sfDesigner

customer_reviews.title: It is exactly what I hoped it would be, sturdy and easy to roll.
customer_reviews.text: Excellent product. It will do what is needed with even much heavier equipment than I own. I doubt it would ever need to be replaced or even repaired unless the thick plastic hubs on two of the wheels crack with age - they seem to be high quality plastic so I think even that would be doubtful. I give this the highest rating.
customer_reviews.author: D. Myerscough

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for DJ's
customer_reviews.text: I'm a DJ and I love this thing - I should have gotten one 10 years ago. I am able to fit both turntables and mixer (in separate road cases) folding table, then throw my laptop bag or record bag on top and roll into the venue in one trip. Folds up compact to keep on stage during the show. Only thing I can slightly gripe about is the grip tape started to come up rather early, but not a huge issue. Still giving it 5 stars. If you are on the fence about it, just go for it!
customer_reviews.author: B R

customer_reviews.title: Like my boyfriend legit moved one of those 4x4 ikea ...
customer_reviews.text: How do you pick up Craigslist furniture in NYC without a car?? With the Rock-N-Roller! Like my boyfriend legit moved one of those 4x4 ikea shelves (~130lbs) across seven avenues with the help of the Rock-N-Roller and some bungee cords. My roommate and I moved a dining room table and 4 dining chairs all at once on this thing. It's simple to use, and can handle a lot!! You do need a wrench for assembly, although before I had a chance to purchase a wrench, I had hand-tightened the nuts and used the thing once or twice without issue. Also some of the railing was super greasy when I was putting it together, but that's a minor nuisance.
customer_reviews.author: Amy

customer_reviews.title: Awesome little cart
customer_reviews.text: Awesome little cart. I bought it for moving, and am offering it to friends to use for moving. Made things a lot easier. The sticker on the side came off the first day, but I prefer stuff to not have the brand names on them. Probably from being in the heat during storage and delivery. Very easy to set up. Basically screwing in tires, the rest come together. I think the cord that you step on to lift up the rails is clever.
customer_reviews.author: Renee

customer_reviews.title: Make sure the Micro will be sufficient, otherwise, go for a larger model.
customer_reviews.text: The R2 Micro model is almost a toy, but I only needed it to transport 2 JBL speakers so it worked out fine. Still, it was a drastic change from the much larger Rock n Roller that I've had & loved for many years. The dimensions are quite small, so I'm gonna bring bungee cables to secure the gear the next time I need to use the micro cart. =)
customer_reviews.author: Lake Placid/Houston Musician

customer_reviews.title: Sturdy enough for your largest friends!
customer_reviews.text: I have searched far and wide for a heavy duty dolly that can handle the crushing pressure of my 400LB best friend. It very versatile! after wheeling her into the car I just toss it in the trunk and easily push her around the farmers market and to KMart with ease! We are able to spend quality time together again!
customer_reviews.author: Heather

customer_reviews.title: Very useful and sturdy
customer_reviews.text: This cart has made my life a lot easier! I offer fitness classes in local parks and use this to haul equipment over grass and sidewalks. It does a great job, saves me tons of time and effort, and I'm so glad I got it. My only complaint is that the mechanism to close down the sides/handles is difficult. It's a coated wire that's situated very close to the frame. You need to press down on it very hard to get the sides/handles to bend inwards so they can close. That's hard to do with such a small clearing.
customer_reviews.author: LCaura

customer_reviews.title: Very nice
customer_reviews.text: Perfect solution to haul items that are a bit too heavy through the house, from the garage or to and from the backyard. Well made, compact, heavy coat of paint, no dings dents or scratches. If I could find anything to criticize about it would plastic wheels could have bushings to take the wear that the plastic spindled wheels will experience while rolling.
customer_reviews.author: Jeff S. Marcus

customer_reviews.title: Great Cart!
customer_reviews.text: I have owned this for several years now and it still functions and works great! I used it to transport audio and lighting equipment for my mobile DJ business. This has worked perfectly and I like the ease of use and folds up compact without taking up too much room in my vehicle.
customer_reviews.author: Djbeez77

customer_reviews.title: Amazing Cart
customer_reviews.text: I have been super impressed by this cart. I have used it to move hundreds of pounds of books around and it has worked extremely well! I wish I had bought it sooner. I have a little trouble collapsing one side of the cart. But I will deal with it, because the alternative is to carry all the books in my arms. Pass.
customer_reviews.author: DisneyFan

customer_reviews.title: Great Balance
customer_reviews.text: The uneven load now stays put. The cart remains balanced. I found that the bungee cord that I use to create sides to hold the load by wrapping it around the upright handles works better.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Highly recommend
customer_reviews.text: Ugh. I bought the micro size. Should have gotten a size larger. My son is able to transport is music gear- Large amp Roadcase (very heavy) and guitar. Will order another size to handle all the equipment. It is a great product. Highly recommended (if you buy the correct size).
customer_reviews.author: Stacey Frizzell

customer_reviews.title: Love this cart
customer_reviews.text: Love this cart! The only reason I didn't give it 5 stars is because the mechanism to lower the front and rear bars is a bit difficult for me to manage. The rope that you have to apply pressure to is very tight and I have to apply a LOT of force for it work (I don't consider myself extremely strong but also not weak). Nonetheless, everything else about it is great and it has so many different functions!
customer_reviews.author: beli8

customer_reviews.title: GREAT Cart!!
customer_reviews.text: I'm shoe broker (sneaker reseller) and I needed a sturdy, easy to use, easy to fold and store cart that was expandable... this cart checks off all the boxes. Very well made and couldn't do without it. You can spend more but not get more... this cart has it all.
customer_reviews.author: AJM

customer_reviews.title: Great cart
customer_reviews.text: Recently moved and we have said many time this might be the best $100 we ever spent. Used it both as a cart and lift truck at various times. For the reviews about the strength, no I would no fully extend it and place the maximum weight in the middle. If you need that buy a commercial cart. Put the heavy stuff over the wheels and it will carry as much as you want to push.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Customer

customer_reviews.title: It’s just, ok
customer_reviews.text: It’s ok. Kinda sorry I bought this one instead of one with bigger tires. If you need to go through dirt or mulch, the tires are no good. If you need something like this, this is better than nothing. It’s small so you can fit it in a tight spot.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great little cart
customer_reviews.text: Great little cart, but two issues. One - One of the holes for the wheels wasn't drilled. Not a big problem, but some pretty bad QC going on here. Two- This one has to do with Amazon (commonly purchased together) suggestions. This cart, the R2 is not compatible with the Multimedia 2 tier shelf, yet amazon is suggesting to buy them together. Luckily I was in need of two carts and have the R10 on order as well, but I don't believe amazon should be suggesting to buy two things together which aren't compatible with one another.
customer_reviews.author: Stefan Scherperel

customer_reviews.title: Lord and Savior
customer_reviews.text: I love this dolly! One of the most best investments and don't feel a single regret at all! I am a college student that lives on campus and this dolly saves me from making multiple trips when I want to bring things in or out. I also don't have to worry about hurting my back either thanks to this dolly :). Definitely will buy again if my dolly were to break.
customer_reviews.author: Wendy Trinh

customer_reviews.title: Even better with the lower and upper deck upgrade!
customer_reviews.text: Been DJ'ing for 20+ years now and Im not getting any younger. This cart/dolly holds enough equipment and save me on time and sweat to set up and tear down. I got the lower and upper deck options and now, i can use this as a secondary table while on gigs. I should have bought this 10 years ago.
customer_reviews.author: Alistair Santiano

customer_reviews.title: Flexible configurations.  Good price.  Great product.
customer_reviews.text: This cart is simply the best! I can load all my gear on it. (Keyboard, stand, bench + peripherals) My favorite part is it’s flexibility. I basically use 2 configurations. It folds small enough to fit in my trunk.
customer_reviews.author: B. C. PoppeTop Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Good, but arrived with missing hardware
customer_reviews.text: The cart is actually very good and handy, but the one I received was missing hardware - I assume because maybe it was previously sold and returned. I made the mistake of not opening the box until I was at a gig and tried to put the cart together and use it, and due to the missing hardware the wheels would not stay on as the cart rolled. Now that I went out and bought the necessary hardware, it works fine and I'm glad to have it.
customer_reviews.author: J. Grady

customer_reviews.title: I Love this one.
customer_reviews.text: I bought it 2 , one for me and other for a friend on me. we both do private events , so we carry equipment from the car to the venue This helps a lot. I own a couple of Subwoofers and speakers. this can take some serious weight. compact and easy to store.
customer_reviews.author: Jeza Yuki

customer_reviews.title: A handy and convertible cart that is well built and affordable
customer_reviews.text: Well built and with brakes in the front tires this cart also converts from a four-wheel-on-the-floor to a two-on hand cart. The mechanism to do this takes a little getting used to, but it works good. I've transported my Northern Star 5500W generator on it and, although it needs 2 people to do this due to each of these item's geometry, the cart didn't struggle with the weight. Doing this, the cart also handled ok going over bumpy grassy terrain.
customer_reviews.author: Frank

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for tailgating
customer_reviews.text: We needed something to get all of our tailgating gear from the truck to our tailgating spot across the street. This cart fits the bill perfectly. We have quite a bit of stuff (tent, 2 tables, grille, grille table, propane tank etc). It handles it all with no problem. It fold up as well so it takes up very little room. It is a MUST have.
customer_reviews.author: Ken Kruger

customer_reviews.title: Compact powerhouse. Lbs of equipment rolls like a dream
customer_reviews.text: After using this for the NFL for one season I was hooked. I hauled 350lbs of equipment over 15 states and had zero problems. Cost an extra check bag fee but worth every penny having this everywhere I go (hotel, stadiums, parking lots, etc). Now I travel for my own business (photo /video) and couldn’t live without it. Seriously powerful for how compact it goes. Btw use your feet leverage to open the handles, buy one and don’t look back.
customer_reviews.author: NOX33

customer_reviews.title: Worth its weight in Gold!
customer_reviews.text: This is a back saver for sure. I can fit my Bose L1 Model II system with the large B2 sub, mic stand, music stand, guitar stand, Gig bag, tip Jar, guitar, and book all on this at once. I went from 4-5 trips down to one with this awesome cart. It collapses down small enough to fit just about anywhere in your car and not take up much room - other than the rear wheels are a bit big. I'm considering putting some larger front wheels on it since it is a bit tough pulling it through grass or Shi**y roads. If you are a musician, you need this!
customer_reviews.author: Loosearrow

customer_reviews.title: Packs a punch and makes work easier.  Used for a year
customer_reviews.text: Use it to carry my dj equipment during gigs and fits great in my car even when I'm packed with equipment. I've fit two turntable flight cases and a mixer flight with a few items on top but dont over do it just so you dont risk gear falling off. Used it for a year+.
customer_reviews.author: julio medina

customer_reviews.title: Not bad not no handles
customer_reviews.text: It’s light. I wish smaller wheels had tread pattern for snow and dirt. No handles. Completely useless in standard dolly mode. Doesn’t bother me cause i always have it laying down. I feel it should be about 75$ or they need to put some handles on it. I made my own single handle with a t wrench since there is a hole in the center
customer_reviews.author: Darrell Coleman

customer_reviews.title: Does the job! Sturdy!
customer_reviews.text: What a great little carrier! Perfect for me to carry sound equipment. Only concern are the wire bands pushed to fold the carrier if they will hold out....but other than that really a well made product
customer_reviews.author: Singerman

customer_reviews.title: My mailman uses this!
customer_reviews.text: I was introduced to this by my mailman. The post office gave them for their trucks. He loves it and fines it sturdy for all packages, I bought it and love it. My boyfriend doesn't like it though because the wheels don't fold for better storage. So I got the one he wanted for better storage and I hate it.
customer_reviews.author: Corky

customer_reviews.title: Perfect. Not one complaint!
customer_reviews.text: Very much worth the price. Highly recommended! I previously used a standard Home Depot 2-way hand truck to move sound equipment, as many in the business do. Having recently downsized my equipment I was in the market for a smaller, lower-capacity cart as well. This fills the bill perfectly- I can shorten the overall length to fit my new rig, thus making every move more manageable, and the cart itself weighs 1/2 as much as the old one, making even that stage of an equipment move easier. There are several models of higher weight capacity for those with more to move.
customer_reviews.author: Harry De Gray Cat

customer_reviews.title: Great for light jobs
customer_reviews.text: I primarily use this cart for my subwoofer and a few odds and ins (mainly lightweight items). Not trying to transport my entire rig with this cart, recommend the more heavy duty carts for gig boxes, amps, speaker main cabinets.
customer_reviews.author: LOUIS SMITH

customer_reviews.title: Cart is not handy
customer_reviews.text: This cart is not great. Does not steer well cannot load to much on it. Nearly dumped all of our stuff. Not even 50 lbs.
customer_reviews.author: Vicki B

customer_reviews.title: wish the handle was higher
customer_reviews.text: taller handle is a bit short for my height (5' 6") to push/pull a full cart. Wish it came up higher. Pulling the cables to fold the handles in takes some getting used to Was easy to put together and rolls nicely. Stores well in my vehicle. I do a lot of trade shows with big boxes for my display and it's holds the supplies well. Just wish the handle came higher. Would like to learn more about the board that can make it into a table.
customer_reviews.author: Tom Hardy

customer_reviews.title: Works great
customer_reviews.text: This little cart is great and easy to transport. We take it with us to vendor events and use it to haul our inventory in and out. We put a piece of plywood across it and it is perfect for what we needed. It seems to be very sturdy!
customer_reviews.author: Elizabeth

customer_reviews.title: A great little cart that can be used for a multitude of things!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this to carry dog crates and other paraphernalia when traveling with my dogs. It works great!! Wish I'd bought it a year ago. It's light weight but holds a ton of stuff. Have carried 4 large dog crates, and plywood board, several bags full of stuff with it and it easily rolled along and over thresholds. It folds down to a small size and doesn't take up much room in the vehicle. The cords to fold the handles down are a bit tricky and you can't always use your foot - but that is the only thing close to a flaw I've found.
customer_reviews.author: SLK

customer_reviews.title: Mighty mouse
customer_reviews.text: This is a great little dolly if you don't have a lot of space. The design is excellent! Holds a heavy load and then folds down into next to nothing. It can be a bit of a prima donna just when you don't feel like fussing with it but I've gotten years of heavy duty use out of it and it's still going strong. Can't live without it.
customer_reviews.author: J Random Customer

customer_reviews.title: Awesome product and so handy for musicians
customer_reviews.text: This is my second cart having used my 1st for over 12 years. Great for moving my PA and guitar rig to local gigs and so portable! Nothing bad about it and comes in several sizes to handle the load you have. Highly recommend to musicians in 4 piece bands playing locally in their area. Makes loading in and out a breeze!
customer_reviews.author: Tom Sayers

customer_reviews.title: Great product for transporting all kind of things.
customer_reviews.text: I am getting older, and dragging garbage to the dumpster is a pain. The R2RT works great. Folds easy to fit in my Dorgano. It can be adjusted for different loads, and the weeks lock.
customer_reviews.author: Glenn

customer_reviews.title: A great small and compact cart
customer_reviews.text: This is my second cart from this company. I have the largest they offer and the smallest model. Only thing I would change on the smaller cart is making the push bars 6" taller.
customer_reviews.author: Big T

customer_reviews.title: Legit.
customer_reviews.text: i'm moving, and am doing it mostly on my own over a short time. This thing is legit. I've carried a tall heavy dresser, several heavy boxes with boxes and records, and many more over bumpy hard nyc side walks. I've definitely used this thing to its weight capacity several times upfront and its held its own. The multi configurations are also pretty rad. Def buy this thing if you can.
customer_reviews.author: Taanderson

customer_reviews.title: good product check the size
customer_reviews.text: ok so this cart is in deed nicely made and the design is practical and that is why i gave it 4 stars BUT this particular model the R2RT is in my opinion a little too small for my needs (DJ equipment) but i will probably order one of the bigger ones so in conclusion check the measurements before you order to make sure is the right size for you.
customer_reviews.author: Q tips

customer_reviews.title: Holds a lot
customer_reviews.text: I'm still figuring out how to get the sides to close. The mechanism is tight (as it should be), so it takes some strength to move the arms away from the frame so it can close. But, I still think this is a great cart.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Strong cart.
customer_reviews.text: This cart works well and is strong. The adjustible length and handles are worth while. The wheels are right and it is made well. Worth the money. CP
customer_reviews.author: cpet25

customer_reviews.title: great assistance to move heavy boxes
customer_reviews.text: I delivery multiple days to UPS, Fedex very often, having this cart is a great plus for us. it save me lots of energy and time. only suggestion is, it's tough to fold it. I hope it can be a lot easier. also, it will be more elegant to use aluminum
customer_reviews.author: Andrew

customer_reviews.title: In love
customer_reviews.text: I gig in a lot of tight neighborhoods where it's impossible to get a good spot for loading/unloading. This thing saves me time, saves my back and transports my gear more safely than if I were to just carry it all by hand. I can fit three amps, pedalboard, gear bag and amp stand on it effectively. It's not long enough to carry a bass case or keyboard but I can live with that.
customer_reviews.author: Brendan Gausvik

customer_reviews.title: Super easy to use
customer_reviews.text: Had a hand truck but wanted an upgrade. This can transport double the amount of goods in one trip, wheels are big but not dummy big. Super easy to maneuver
customer_reviews.author: Meimei

customer_reviews.title: The best
customer_reviews.text: I often have to move several boxes at once and this cart has made it so much easier. I love how you don't need any tools to adjust the size or the position. And I live in a small apartment so it's a huge benefit to be able to break this down and store it under my bed. Not sure how I managed without this cart for so long!! I highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: hellosunshine101

customer_reviews.title: This thing is DIESEL!!'
customer_reviews.text: Good, stong and light. I was sceptical if this cart could really support 300lbs when its extended and YES IT DOES!!! Gave four stars because the handles are a little low for me, I'm 6' and the handle is right at my pockets so I don't have to hunch forward to use but it would be nice with some more height. Regardless of this factor I would highly reccomend this product. I use it for vending and it reduces the amount of back and fourth trips when setting up.
customer_reviews.author: Tommy Filippini

customer_reviews.title: great lil dollie
customer_reviews.text: works awesome. using for my RTIC ice chests. Fits almost any size and rolls fantastic. much less expensive than the cooler manufacturer or aftermarket wheels for the ice chests.
customer_reviews.author: Cross U

customer_reviews.title: Awesome tool
customer_reviews.text: We had these at work and I always wanted one so I didn't have to us our office ones cause sometimes we would run out. They're great for catering order can hold up to 4-5 catering bags for one trip. Also they were pretty cheap on here which made it nicer.
customer_reviews.author: Kawaihala

customer_reviews.title: Well built, versatile cart
customer_reviews.text: This cart allows me to continue to do what I love. As an older acoustic musician, hauling equipment is my least favorite part of performing. This cart allows me to just make one trip for smaller venues. Expanding the cart allows me to haul my larger system in one trip too, minus guitars. Thank you for providing a well built, innovative product. I had a minor issue with some sharp edges on the frame that was quickly fixed with a metal file. Keep up the great work!
customer_reviews.author: Creigh Johnson

customer_reviews.title: Great, but small
customer_reviews.text: Great little cart, could be larger, but then my wife couldn't manage it by herself - which is the reason we got it: to support her shows that she does for the fabric products she makes and the hair accessories she resells. We/I need to move tables of various sizes - 4 foot, 6 foot, card tables, tray tables - as well as tubs of products and odd shaped racks and displays, as I help her to unload/load and setup/breakdown the booth arrangements (no two of which are the same...).
customer_reviews.author: Mike Walton

customer_reviews.title: CHEAP and not as easy as described.
customer_reviews.text: Cheaply made ! Not easy to maneuver! Did not like at all
customer_reviews.author: Nancy N. Ryan

customer_reviews.title: This cart is AWESOME!
customer_reviews.text: This is cart is awesome! It was an upgrade from my Safco foldable dolly. Used this cart for round trip transporting percussion gear from car to gig venues. Also used for carting my family's suitcases, food bags and cooler from car to hotel room during family vacations. No need for bell hope service. I love this cart!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Nice little cart
customer_reviews.text: Nice little cart. Kind of wish I'd bought the larger one, but this one should do OK. Once I figured out how to raise and fold the handle I was good to go.
customer_reviews.author: Eric S.

customer_reviews.title: DJ Must Have
customer_reviews.text: I was recommended this device to carry all my heavy duty equipment and expensive gear. And it works!! I am a mobile DJ and this has saved my back everytime I go out for any of my DJ gigs. After the pandemic is over this will still be my number 1 must have!
customer_reviews.author: Hugo G

customer_reviews.title: Great little versatile cart
customer_reviews.text: This product was perfect for what I needed. It was a little hard at first to fold the handles up and down because the cord was hard, but after a few uses the cord has "broken-in" now so it is much easier to adjust. Or maybe I just got the hang of it. It is extremely versatile and I've used it for moving various things. The only position I haven't tried is as a furniture dolly and probably won't, just prefer to haul things around with it.
customer_reviews.author: icoop

customer_reviews.title: This is wonderful. I'm a freelance photographer
customer_reviews.text: This is wonderful. I'm a freelance photographer, and bought it at the recommendation of a videographer when I saw his cart at a shoot. I used it to move around several bags of lighting and backdrop equipment, and it stays folded compactly in the back of my car when not in use. My boyfriend is also a photographer and just borrowed it to move even more gear onto a ferry, and he liked it so much that he's buying one for himself after a single use.
customer_reviews.author: WhatCCSaw

customer_reviews.title: Perfect For Band Member
customer_reviews.text: This thing is so well built, its awesome. The manufacturer has a complete line of these carts but for the money, it does what I need. It folds up, fits in my trunk, unfolds in seconds, I carry two bass cases, 75lb Fender Amp, stands, music stand and stool. One trip and all my gear is on or off the stage.
customer_reviews.author: Gilbert P.

customer_reviews.title: Must Buy For Small and Large Moves
customer_reviews.text: This is a very versatile cart. It works beyond what is advertised. I am extremely happy with it. I bought this cart to move items to and from my apartment and the garage. It works great from packing boxes, totes, water jugs, small and large jobs.
customer_reviews.author: KenKen

customer_reviews.title: This is the best cart.
customer_reviews.text: As advertised! Sturdy, well constructed, quality materials, easy to assemble. Just what I needed. I’m very happy with this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Ken McA

customer_reviews.title: I have to stoop to push it in it's cart configuration
customer_reviews.text: I had higher hopes for this. I LOVE that it's lightweight and that I can multi-configure it: lengthen, shorten, handtruck, cart, etc. What I really don't like is that the short bar is over the large wheels, making me stoop to push it as a cart! Look at the photo to see what I mean. However, the two end bars are secured by pins, so I think I'll try to switch them since I'll be using it more as a cart than as a handtruck.
customer_reviews.author: Glory2God!

customer_reviews.title: Missing/Broken Pieces
customer_reviews.text: I ordered this for my husband's birthday, but when we went to put it together, there were cotter pins missing and broken washers. Had to go to Home Depot to replace the missing parts. Disappointed in this purchase.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: A great help.
customer_reviews.text: I use this to wheel my heavy hammer dulcimer from the car to the places where I play. We also use it at home to wheel heavy loads from the car to the house. We are in our 70's. My only regret is that it is not a little lighter in weight
customer_reviews.author: Susan

customer_reviews.title: Saved my back!
customer_reviews.text: I cannot go on enough about what this product has done for me. I teach onsite classes and have to carry in a lot of equipment. Before this purchase, I carried everything like a pack mule. It is amazing I can still walk upright. I highly recommend this to everyone.
customer_reviews.author: Brian M. Reeves

customer_reviews.title: Superbly Strong, Small cart
customer_reviews.text: The cart is rugged and puts up with a lot. However, be aware the R2RT Micro is just what it says... Micro. I have the R10 and it fits all the broadcast equipment I could ever need to carry. With this new Micro, I had to really get creative to fit a 5-piece drum set plus hardware.
customer_reviews.author: Olympus Broadcast

customer_reviews.title: Best $100 spent on gig gear in a while!
customer_reviews.text: This thing is great so far! What a difference it makes lugging your Open Mic gig gear to and fro! Would buy it again!
customer_reviews.author: BennyT

customer_reviews.title: Lifesaver
customer_reviews.text: Wouldn't have been able to move without this life saver. A little hard to put together, but when it starts rolling, it works great in all positions! Definitely recommended!
customer_reviews.author: ALI

customer_reviews.title: Good buy.
customer_reviews.text: Strong to hold equipment. Expandable to hold more stuff. I use this often when working. Good to move things around with.
customer_reviews.author: Shaun F.

customer_reviews.title: A Must Have for Moble DJs!
customer_reviews.text: I've used these carts to transport my sensitive DJ equipment many times before so I had expectations and this didn't disappoint. It arrived quickly, was easy to assemble with a couple of tools, and performs like a champ! You can't go wrong with this!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon User

customer_reviews.title: Small, pins in wheels don't stay, worthless when you lose the pin.
customer_reviews.text: After putting together, the pins immediately fell out of the wheels. It's very small. Worthless when the pins don't stay in and get lost.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Woooooow!!!!!!
customer_reviews.text: I just recently moved to another apartment about some feet away from my old one i needed this cart to help move things and wow! Best investment i ever made, it's very sturdy and carries a lot of stuff and rolls very smooth, this made moving very easy i love it! I highly recommend it, great quality for sure.
customer_reviews.author: Someone

customer_reviews.title: Not as easy to use as it looks
customer_reviews.text: I returned the first one because I couldn’t get the long handle to come up. I had the same problem with the second one except this time I pulled really hard on the cord and it came up. I feel the cord will break if I have to pull that hard every time. I haven’t used it yet ..just frustrated at putting it together and having to work so hard to lift up handles. They make it look so easy on YouTube.
customer_reviews.author: Lei

product_meta.title: Rock-N-Roller R2RT (Micro) 8-in-1 Folding Multi-Cart/Hand Truck/Dolly/Platform Cart/26" to 39" Telescoping Frame/350 lbs. Load Capacity, Black
feature_bullets: Instantly transforms into 8 different shapes, replacing 8 different cart types
Carries huge amounts of equipment yet folds small for storage
R-Trac tires ride smoothly with excellent traction, like pneumatic tires without the hassle of upkeep or repair
Textured, powder coated steel is durable and also reduces slippage during transport
Featured in college engineering textbooks for its outstanding design. Polypropylene Hub with Polyurethane Foam tires
